content: need for speed by stitchnerd designs you ll need a needle size that produces the given gauge probably 9mm - us 13 - straight or circular yarn super bulky approx 70m/77 yds per 100g - check the yardage as the term super bulky can be used to cover a wide range of weights if your yarn has less yardage you ll need to cast on fewer stitches yardage needed tall single - approx 130m 145 yds single with a twist - approx 200m 220 yds double loop - approx 250m 275 yds finished size approx 27cm/10 deep the length will stitchnerd countess ablaze roving on 9mm us 13 vary according to your yardage or taste click on yarn or projects tabs on the need for speed pattern page on ravelry for more yarn ideas gauge per 10cm/4 approx 10 stitches and 16 row swatching as this is so few stitches it s not really necessary to swatch you can just start but be sure to check your gauge after you have done several row if you knit tighter than the given gauge you may not have enough yarn to make the length you want if you measure the length after you ve used 10% of your yarn you can multiply by 10 to determine the length you ll be able to achieve if the width is not to your liking you can adjust the number of stitches use any odd number the green tape is measuring the width the silver ruler is measuring the length © ashcroft-hempsall 2015 - for personal non-commercial use only speed 2 making the cowl edge - if you knit the first stitch through the back loop you ll get the neat braided edge you see in the top example cast on 27 sts or other odd the bottom example shows the edge you get if you knit into number if you are adjusting the front of the first stitch using either of the following methods provisional - you will graft/kitchener together the 2 ends or use 3-needle bind-off or regular long tail or cable - you will join the two ends together and have a seam or you can do what i call half- kitchener and graft the live stitches to the cast-on edge all row are worked the same way k1 through the back loop then p1 k1 to the last 2 stitches p1 then slip the last stitch purlwise with the yarn in front work until you have just enough yarn left to finish in your chosen way see above you can baste/tack the ends together and try it on to check before finishing see next page twisted variation for this one i cast on 35 stitches and then twisted the strip of knitting 180° before binding off using 3-needle bind-off see next page for positioning photos 12 x 36 30 x 90 cm it gives nice drape and a chunky feel without the bulk of a double-loop la drogerie baby douceur on
